pr_title: Issue #7660: Add code example for StringLiteralEquality

accepted -> OK
closing parentheses is missing

timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,19 @@ * 
  * <module name="StringLiteralEquality"/>
  *
- * + *

+ * Examples of how the check works if this module is used: + *

+ * 
+ * if (status == "done") // violation
+ * System.out.println("success!")
+ * if (status.equals("done") // accepted
+ * System.out.println("success!")
+ * if (status != "done") // violation
+ * System.out.println("wait")
+ * if (!status.equals("done")) // accepted
+ * System.out.println("wait")

timeline.bodyText: no semicolon here and in statements above
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,20 @@ * 
  * <module name="StringLiteralEquality"/>
  *
+ *

+ * Examples of violations: + *

+ * 
+ * if (status == "done")            // violation
+ *   System.out.println("success!")
+ * if (status.equals("done"))       // OK
+ *   System.out.println("success!")
  *
+ * if (status != "done")            // violation
+ *   System.out.println("wait")
+ * if (!status.equals("done"))      // OK
+ *   System.out.println("wait")

timeline.bodyText: please make this and other comments like if (status == "done") // violation, with only one white space separation
timeline.author: strkkk

replies.bodyText: @strkkk Applied all the changes, let me know if there's anything else to be changed
replies.author: gaurabdg

timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,8 +25,13 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes; /** - *

Checks that string literals are not used with - * {@code ==} or !=. + *

+ * Checks that string literals are not used with == or !=. + * Since == will compare the object addresses, not the actual value of the strings,

timeline.bodyText:
It is not clear what "OK" means here as user sees no string except in the method parameter. I would remove the parameter to not confuse the user, keep the method call and name, and add to "OK"
limitation that check cannot tell runtime type returned from method call.
timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,7 +51,18 @@ * 
  * <module name="StringLiteralEquality"/>
  *
+ *

+ * Examples of violations: + *

+ * 
+ * if (status == "done") {} // violation
  *
+ * boolean flag = (status == "done") // violation
+ *
+ * boolean flag = (status.equals("done")) // OK
+ *
+ * if (name == getName("x")) {} // OK

replies.bodyText: It may help to show with context status and name are string variables. Usually our examples are valid, java code to showcase a real example and not tiny snippets of the world that lead to interpretation.
replies.author: rnveach

timeline.bodyText: Add 1 more example of != that will cause a violation. Something distinct from the others like a loop.
timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:

+ *
